questions.question: Which word is most nearly OPPOSITE in meaning to 'abstemious' (in lifestyle)?
questions.explanation: Abstemious living avoids excess, especially in pleasure; 'hedonistic' centers life on pleasure and indulgence.

questions.question: Which word is most nearly OPPOSITE in meaning to 'adulterate'?
questions.explanation: To adulterate is to contaminate or make impure; 'purify' means to remove contaminants.

questions.question: Which word is most nearly OPPOSITE in meaning to 'amalgamate'?
questions.explanation: Amalgamate means combine into one; 'segregate' means separate into groups.

questions.question: Which word is most nearly OPPOSITE in meaning to 'apathy' (again, focusing on intensity)?
questions.explanation: Apathy is lack of feeling; 'fervor' suggests intense, burning enthusiasm.

questions.question: Which word is most nearly OPPOSITE in meaning to 'assiduous'?
questions.explanation: Assiduous means showing great care and persistence; 'negligent' means failing to take proper care.

questions.question: Which word is most nearly OPPOSITE in meaning to 'attenuate'?
questions.explanation: Attenuate means to weaken or reduce; 'amplify' means to increase or strengthen.

questions.question: Which word is most nearly OPPOSITE in meaning to 'banal'?
